itemdesc-handbell: A small handbell. The silver of the bell seems to have a weird purplep shimmer to it...
itemdesc-smallbellparts-silver: The more intricate parts of a small bell
itemdesc-royalhorn: A mighty horn, used to announce the coming of the great ones of this world.
itemdesc-perfectgoathorn: A goat horn in perfect condition. It is rare to find one of this quality.
itemdesc-warhorn: A rustic war horn, used to rally even the most distant allies.
itemdesc-royalhornhead-blackbronze: A bell (head) for a royal horn, made of black bronze.
itemdesc-telegraphwire: A spool of wire. Its simplistic design allows it to be used only for creating a telegraph network.
itemdesc-wirecutter-tinbronze: A specialized tool for cutting wire connections.
itemdesc-megaphone: A megaphone that allows you to carry your voice far. Beware of walls blocking the sound!
itemdesc-enhancedmegaphone: This extremely rare megaphone has the unique ability to carry sound across distances and through matter.
itemdesc-paperslip: A piece of paper used for printing telegrams.
itemdesc-telegram: A printed telegram containing a telegraphic message.

blockdesc-callbell: A small bell that can be rung to call someone.
blockdesc-carillonbell-*: A carillon bell that can ring a melody for an entire village.
blockdesc-printer-*: A telegraph printer that stores messages as telegrams when placed under a telegraph key. Requires paper slips.
Printer.Warning.Full: Warning: printer full (all telegram slots occupied)!
blockdesc-telegraph-*: Also called a Morse key, this switching device allows an operator to send signals over a wired telegraph network.
blockdesc-connector-*: An insulator used to extend a wired communication network. The color is purely aesthetic.
blockdesc-signallamp-*: A signal lamp that lights up when right-click is held. Used for signaling and communication.
Welding.MissingFlux: This needs more borax as flux
Welding.TooCold: Some of the parts are too cold to weld
Command.Shout.Desc: Sets the shout distance in blocks
Command.Talk.Desc: Sets the talk distance in blocks
Command.Whisper.Desc: Sets the whisper distance in blocks
Command.Info.Desc: Displays the current audio distances and toggles
Command.Reset.Desc: Resets the audio distances to their default settings
Command.ForceNameTags.Desc: Toggles forceful name tag rendering when people are talking
Command.ForceNameTags.Help: If nametags are on at all times this setting does nothing. Default value is true
Command.ForceNameTags.Success.Enabled: Name tags WILL render during speech even if they were hidden
Command.ForceNameTags.Success.Disabled: Name tags WILL NOT render during speech if they were hidden
Command.EncodeAudio.Desc: Toggles audio encoding. See help for more info
Command.EncodeAudio.Help: Audio encoding drastically decreases bandwidth usage but will affect audio quality and may create artifacts. If bandwidth isn't a concern for you or you are experiencing glitchy audio - try disabling the encoding. Default value is on
Command.OthersHearSpectators.Desc: Toggles whether others can hear spectators talk. See help for more info
Command.OthersHearSpectators.Help: This setting determines whether people in all gamemode can hear what spectators are saying or only other spectators can. Default value is true which means others can hear spectators
Command.OthersHearSpectators.Success.Dis: Only spectators can now hear spectators
Command.VoiceBan.Desc: Bans a player from voice chat. Banned players cannot be heard by anyone
Command.VoiceUnban.Desc: Unbans a player from voice chat
Command.VoiceBanList.Desc: Lists all players currently voice banned
Command.VoiceBanList.Empty: No players are currently voice banned
Command.Announce.Desc: Displays an announcement to all connected players
Command.Announce.Help: Format: Title | Message | Duration (default 5) | glass (optional, semi-transparent background). Example: /rpvc announce Server Restart | Save in 5 minutes | 10 | glass
Command.Announce.Usage: Usage: /rpvc announce Title | Message | Duration | glass
Command.Announce.MissingSeparator: Missing separator '|'. Usage: /rpvc announce Title | Message | Duration | glass
Command.Announce.InvalidDuration: Invalid duration '{0}'. Must be a positive number.
Gui.AudioWizardDialog.FirstParagraph: Welcome to audio configuration wizard, it will help you configure your input device. You should be able to hear yourself right now, if that's not the case make sure that this is your device:
Gui.AudioWizardDialog.SecondParagraph: Let's configure your recording volume. Press the button below and start talking like you normally would. Keep talking until the progress bar is filled. Other players can't hear you right now so don't worry about them.
Gui.AudioWizardDialog.Done: All done! Your recording volume was automatically calibrated, enjoy playing~
Gui.FirstLaunchDialog.FirstParagraph: It looks like this is your first time using RPVoiceChat mod. Would you like to automatically configure your input device? It will take less than a minute.
Gui.FirstLaunchDialog.SecondParagraph: This window will only show once but you can always launch configuration wizard from the Mod Menu("{0}" key).
Gui.ModMenu.inputDevice.Label: Input Device
Gui.ModMenu.togglePushToTalk.Label: Push To Talk
Gui.ModMenu.togglePushToTalk.Tooltip: Use push to talk instead of voice activation
Gui.ModMenu.muteMicrophone.Label: Mute
Gui.ModMenu.loopback.Label: Loopback
Gui.ModMenu.loopback.Tooltip: Play recorded audio through output audio
Gui.ModMenu.monoMode.Label: Mono Mode
Gui.ModMenu.monoMode.Tooltip: Disable 3D audio positioning - all voices will be heard from the center
Gui.ModMenu.outputVoice.Label: Players Volume Level
Gui.ModMenu.outputVoice.Tooltip: How much to increase volume of other players
Gui.ModMenu.outputBlock.Label: Blocks Volume Level
Gui.ModMenu.outputBlock.Tooltip: How much to increase volume of sound emmited by mod's blocks (like bells)
Gui.ModMenu.outputItem.Label: Items Volume Level
Gui.ModMenu.outputItem.Tooltip: How much to increase volume of sound emmited by mod's items (like horns)
Gui.ModMenu.inputGain.Label: Recording Volume
Gui.ModMenu.inputThreshold.Label: Audio Input Threshold
Gui.ModMenu.inputThreshold.Tooltip: At which threshold your audio starts transmitting
Gui.ModMenu.audioMeter.Label: Audio Meter
Gui.ModMenu.audioWizard.Label: Audio Wizard
Gui.ModMenu.audioWizard.Tooltip: Opens AudioWizard which will automatically configure your recording volume
Gui.ModMenu.toggleHUD.Label: Toggle HUD
Gui.ModMenu.minimalHUD.Label: Minimal HUD
Gui.ModMenu.minimalHUD.Tooltip: Reduce all voice icons to a single colored dot to minimize HUD screen space usage
Gui.ModMenu.toggleMuffling.Label: Muffling
Gui.ModMenu.toggleMuffling.Tooltip: Muffle audio when other players are behind solid obstacles
Gui.ModMenu.toggleDenoising.Label: Denoising
Gui.ModMenu.denoisingSensitivity.Label: Background noise detection
Gui.ModMenu.denoisingSensitivity.Tooltip: Sets sensitivity for background noise. Audio detected as noise will be denoised with max strength.
Gui.ModMenu.denoisingStrength.Label: Denoising strength
Gui.ModMenu.denoisingStrength.Tooltip: Sets intensity of denosing for audio detected as voice. Lower it if your voice is too distorted.
Gui.ModMenu.toggleChannelGuessing.Label: Detect audio channels
Gui.ModMenu.toggleChannelGuessing.Toolti: If multichannel audio capture is supported we will use it and then filter out empty channels to account for cases when input device writes in non-default channels(for example, stereo audio on channels 3 and 4 instead of 1 and 2). Disabling this will make mod use all captured channels which will likely decrease your volume by x2/x4.
Gui.ModMenu.inputSensitivity.Label: Max input threshold
Gui.ModMenu.inputSensitivity.Tooltip: Used to scope input threshold to a shorter interval, which allows for finer control of voice activation. Decrease it if you have to set input threshold very low. Increase if Audio Meter on the audio input tab easily gets filled. Has no effect on the actual volume
Gui.ModMenu.unscaledAudioMeter.Label: Unscaled Audio Meter
Gui.ModMenu.unscaledAudioMeter.Tooltip: Shows your audio amplitude on the actual full scale, before applying max input threshold. Use it as a reference for setting max input threshold(segment to the left from the slider handle will be displayed in audio input tab)
RelayNode.NoNetwork: Relay node - Not connected to any network.
Telegraph.Gui.Title: Telegraph
Wire.ConnectionTooFar: Too far! Max distance is {0} blocks.
Wire.CannotBreakConnected: Cannot break block: it is connected to at least one other block. Use a wirecutter to remove connections first.
Handbook.Welding.block-churchbell-part.T:
First step is to clayform the mold for your bell part and filling the molds with brass. For each of the three lower layers you will need 4 parts.

Second step is to heat the parts of the layer you're constructing. After heating the parts must be assembled together and will need 4 pieces of powdered borax for the welding.

Step three is to hit that thing with a hammer quite a few times.
First step is to perform the part welding process for three of the four layers. (The top layer doesn't need to be welded)

Second step is to heat up each of the layers that you have assembled and then assemble them into the final shape. This takes 3 pieces of powdered borax.

The third step is to hit it with a hammer again.
Handbook.Welding.block-churchbell.Title: Welding Process: Full Bell
Handbook.Welding.block-churchbell.Text:
The welding process for the entire bell is to first weld each (except for the topmost) layer of the bell this process can be found on the handbook page for the bell parts.

There are four layers and when they're welded you can then weld them into the full bell. That process can be seen on the handbook page for the layers.
Handbook.Usage.block-churchbell.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.block-churchbell.Text: This is a massive 3x3x4 size churchbell that when right clicked rings and can be clearly heard out to a distance of 832 blocks away. It needs to be placed on the ground and will require a free 3x3x4 space around it.
Handbook.Usage.smallbellparts.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.smallbellparts.Text: These are more intricate parts that can be used to craft a small bell. You believe you might also be able to attach these to doors for a nice announcement of when someone enters or leaves.
Handbook.Usage.block-callbell.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.block-callbell.Text: This is a callbell that can be placed on the ground and, when right clicked, rings and can be clearly heard out to a distance of 16 blocks away.
Handbook.Usage.item-handbell.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.item-handbell.Text: This is a small handbell. When held in your hand, right-clicking it causes you to ring it. Its sound can be clearly heard up to 16 blocks away.
Handbook.Usage.item-royalhorn.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.item-royalhorn.Text: This is a long metal horn. When held in your hand, right-clicking it causes you to blow into it. Its sound can be clearly heard up to 72 blocks away.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-blackb: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note C over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-bismut: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note C# over a distance of 256 blocks.
This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note D over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-tinbro: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note D# over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-copper: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note E over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-tin.Te: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note F over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-zinc.T: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note F# over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-lead.T: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note G over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-bismut: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note G# over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-silver: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note A over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-cupron: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note A# over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-gold.T: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note B over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.block-carillonbell-electr: This is a carillon bell. Hanging from the ceiling, right-clicking it will ring it, playing the note C(8va) over a distance of 256 blocks.
Handbook.Usage.item-warhorn.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.item-warhorn.Text: This is a warhorn, made of genuine goat horn. When held in your hand, right-clicking it causes you to blow into it. Its sound can be clearly heard up to 128 blocks away.
Handbook.Usage.block-connector.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.block-connector.Text: The insulator allows extending a telegraph network by connecting a wire to it. This element is inert and cannot create networks on its own, but it is essential for linking different sections of your telegraph installation.
Handbook.Usage.block-telegraph.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.block-telegraph.Text: The telegraph key allows sending and receiving messages. Right-click on it to use it. It emits an audible sound code within a maximum radius of 5 blocks. Messages are currently stored during the session, but in the future they will be deleted after 10 seconds and can be saved using a printer.
Handbook.Usage.item-telegraphwire.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.item-telegraphwire.Text: This telegraph wire spool allows extending a network over a maximum distance of 20 blocks, by right-clicking on the first then the second element to connect. To cover greater distances, insulators (relays) are necessary to extend the network.
Handbook.Usage.item-wirecutter.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.item-wirecutter.Text: A specialized tool for cutting wire connections in telegraph networks. Right-click on any connected communication network block or insulator to remove all its wire connections. This allows you to reconfigure your network or remove connections before breaking blocks.
Handbook.Usage.item-megaphone.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.item-megaphone.Text: The rarity of the components used makes this tool valuable for long-distance communications and emergency situations. Hold down the right click to activate voice amplification, carrying your voice over 125 blocks. The sound of your voice is still affected by distance and obstacles.
Handbook.Usage.item-enhancedmegaphone.Te: An exceptional megaphone commissioned by the Administrator and forged by the renowned scientist Jonas. A symbol of power and administrative authority, only a privileged few possess such equipment. Hold down the right click to activate voice amplification over long distances and through matter (regardless of the distance in blocks).
Handbook.Usage.item-paperslip.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.item-paperslip.Text: A piece of paper used by the printer to create telegrams. Place it in the printer to enable automatic printing of telegraphic messages.
Handbook.Usage.item-telegram.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.item-telegram.Text: A printed telegram containing a complete telegraphic message. Each telegram contains a unique message and can be kept as proof of communication.
Handbook.Usage.block-printer.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.block-printer.Text: A telegraph printer that can be placed under a telegraph key. Telegraph messages are automatically deleted after a configurable delay, but if a printer is connected, the message will be saved to a telegram before deletion. Place paper slip to be printed in the top slot and retrieve printed telegrams from the other slots.
Handbook.Usage.block-signallamp.Title: Usage
Handbook.Usage.block-signallamp.Text: A signal lamp that lights up when you hold right-click. The lamp emits light only while the button is held, making it useful for signaling and communication.
starterguide-text:
RP Voice Chat - Starter Guide
Shout at your enemies, talk with your friends, conspire with your allies.

This mod implements VoIP to allow people on a server together to talk using microphones in-game based on proximity. It includes also a bunch of in-game communication tools !

About VoIP
To open the configuration menu you can press the keybind which by default is set to "P". Make sure to double check the keybinds. They're under user interface and have the prefix "RPVoice".
You cycle between the following speech levels with a keybind defined in your settings.

These dictate how far your voice can be heard.
Whispering: Reaches max 5 blocks
Talking: Reaches max 15 blocks
Shouting: Reaches max 25 blocks

The above distances can be set per world using chat commands. Using these commands require server control privileges.
The commands are all subcommands of "/rpvc" so just use "/help rpvc" and you should get more information.

Audio effecys
TO DO

Communication tools
RP Voice Chat includes more than VoIP. You will find items and blocks that will give you new ways to communicate. For example :
Horns
Bells
Telegraph
Megaphones
horns-text:
RP Voice Chat - Horns

Horns are wind instruments used to communicate orders or alerts from a distance. Each has its use:

Royal horn: forged musical instrument, to harangue the people
Warhorn: horn whose sound resounds over long distances to warn its allies
bells-text:
RP Voice Chat - Bells

Bells have always announced victories, defeats, festivities or deaths. You will find a bell for each use:

Handbell: short-range hand bell
Callbell: counter bell to alert of its presence
Small bell parts: element used for the first two items but usable on doors
Carillon bell: bell emitting a different tone depending on the metal used
Church bell: bell so big that it has to be welded
telegraph-text:
RP Voice Chat - Telegraph

The telegraph system allows transmitting coded messages over long distances through a network of wires and specialized equipment. This revolutionary technology enables you to communicate silently with your allies over great distances, perfect for coordinating strategies or transmitting sensitive information.

The telegraph works through an audible sound code within a limited radius around the device.

Telegraph key: main device for sending and receiving coded messages
Telegraph wire: spool allowing connection of equipment
Insulator: essential connector for extending and structuring your telegraph network
Wire cutter: tool for cutting wire connections to reconfigure networks
Printer: prints telegrams when placed under a telegraph key; requires paper slips
megaphones-text:
RP Voice Chat - Megaphones

Megaphones amplify your voice far beyond normal speech range. You will be able to use different models:

Megaphone: carries your voice up to 125 blocks; still affected by distance and obstacles
Administrator's Megaphone: exceptional device, whose manufacturing secret Jonas took to his grave, carrying voice over long distances and through matter
